reviews.text: Funny museum but still with lots of information about the genitals of mammals, it's interesting to see how similar to human body these animals are. Despite the fact that you're going to see lots of penises, is really interesting. I highly recommend to give yourself 1 hour or so to visit this museum, have some fun and learn something too.

This place is little smaller than I thought it would be. The collection is both fascinating and surprisingly educational, offering insight into biology, culture, and even humor. The exhibits are well-organized, with informative descriptions that make the experience both fun and enlightening.

Of course, we went for the jokes. But it turned out to be a truly academic experience as well. I would say the oddity of someone collecting this particular feature of anatomy is as big a draw as the actual collection. It’s the train wreck - you feel you must look. But then, when you’re in there, it’s pretty fascinating. I also think it’s somewhat intriguing because there’s no way there could be a vagina museum. People wouldn’t go. Simply not as interesting. So there’s a bit of joy in finally finding a collection of male-sex-related gawking material. Glad for it.

The phallological museum is brilliant! It's very informative and yet as you can imagine doesn't take itself too seriously all of the time! It's definitely a great way to spend an hour or two when visiting Reykjavik. Definitely recommended.

Ended up being much more scientific than expected.  Very interesting and of course a little goofy but that’s to be expected with a museum of “richards”. Be prepared to see over 80 animal phalluses and some human ones too. The gift shop at the end is adorable, too. I would recommend it to my friends if they visit Iceland.

Also, there’s a cafe inside with a couple food items, drinks, and hot beverages.
